attributes.action: Make a plastic tax, anything with a plastic wrapping you have to pay a 2p tax
attributes.background: I want to make a plastic tax so all plastic products sold have to pay a 2p plastic tax the money made will go towards cleaning the UK coasts of rubbish and help repopulate the sea with sea life.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 8 billion tonnes of plastic is dumped into the ocean every year. Fish then eat it and then it works it way into our diet. Pvc is the most dangerous man made object and it's 30% of all plastic. It can cause cancer.
Plastic doesn't erode for 450 to 1000 year's

attributes.action: Raise paternity pay to a minimum of 75% of your weekly income
attributes.background: Currently paternity leave is around £140 or 90% of your weekly income whichever is lower. Due to this fathers cant afford to take time off to be with a newborn or have to take annual leave. I myself just had a child and cant take paternity leave as I would be over £200 out of pocket each week.
attributes.additional_details: Lets get this to parliament and give fathers the chance to be with their kids from the start. There are all these fathers who don't want to spend time with their kids and the ones who do can't. Lets change this for fathers and kids in the UK lets allow fathers to bond with their newborns. Please sign this petition. THANKS

attributes.action: Increase the legal age limit in gambling shops to 25
attributes.background: Gambling is like crack cocaine addiction and i have been gambling from 18 and now im 21 turning 22 it has affected my mental health and has ruined my life at a young age so i say that the goverment should put a new age limit on gambling and help people stuck in this addiction
attributes.additional_details: Gambling has ruined my life and im only 21 turning 22 in april the goverment should be strict and look into this matter to stop allowing businesses to create more gambling stations in poor communities and instead build something resourceful for the people in need

attributes.action: Increase government funding for child abuse organisations and therapy services.
attributes.background:
Thousands of children everyday are being abused, in the UK.  
How can we as citizens do nothing to help the vulnerable children being tormented?  How can we let the dreams of the youth be destroyed?
 They will be OUR FUTURE! YOU can make a difference by signing this petition.
attributes.additional_details:
-There are currently over 57,000 children identified as needing protection from abuse in the UK
-For every child identified as needing protection from abuse, another 8 are suffering abuse. 
https://www.nspcc.org.uk/services-and-resources/research-and-resources/statistics/

Remember YOU can help change their lives. So, support this cause.

attributes.action: Ban all landlords from stopping tenants having pets.
attributes.background: Currently in the uk millions of people are either private or housing association tenants, that rises each year. At present a landlord can tell a tenant if they can or can't have a pet. Approximately 7 million+ animals enter shelters each year. No landlord should have the right to disallow pets.

attributes.action: Protect employee privacy by making electronic monitoring illegal
attributes.background: In some companies employees are tracked so closely that their managers can see if they pause between tasks or, even stop for a chat. Some companies are even monitoring workers metabolism. Some use 'badges worn by employees to record their movements, interactions and “speaking patterns”
attributes.additional_details:
Employment monitoring article https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/20/digital-giants-workers-robots-film-employee-monitoring-the-circle

BBC news Which! Report on personal data being sold. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-38694016

New York Times
https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/18/technology/data-crunching-is-coming-to-help-your-boss-manage-your-time.html

attributes.action: Pass: Representation of the People Act - Additional Member System (AMS / MMP)
attributes.background: Our voting system forces the major parties to devote to only swing seats. It doesn't treat voters equally. In parts of the country the opposition parties put up nothing more than a token effort in elections. Regions are dominated by one party despite opponents recording substantial numbers of votes.
attributes.additional_details:
"First past the post has been a huge contributing factor in how remote people feel from politics. As vote share for the major two parties has declined, it is a fact that our general elections have become less and less representative ... It should be a source of national concern that there have been three general elections in history in which the party with the most votes has actually lost the general election."

Source: - http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/blog/jonathan-reynolds-speech

attributes.action: guarantee all EU football players be exempt from net migration targets
attributes.background: Parliament needs to guarantee that in the forthcoming Brexit negotiations there will be provision made for the free movement of all EU football players to work in UK Football Clubs. A lot of football supporters need reassurance that this group of workers will be exempted from immigration targets.

attributes.action: Make Mr Jeremy Hunt work in a busy hospital for a week so he can see for himself
attributes.background: It seems Mr Jeremy Hunt has an inaccurate view of the NHS and the pressure on it. Before he runs into the ground one of the greatest achievements in world history that is a big part of being British, he should work 12 hour shifts for a week to see how the system needs help.

attributes.action: Lobby the IOC in order for Darts to become an Olympic Sport.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport should create a task force in order to lobby the IOC for Darts to be recognised as a sport. They should then have direct involvement in the process of applying to become an Olympic Sport at the earliest opportunity.
attributes.additional_details:
Darts meets almost all requirements stipulated by the Olympic charter.

Sports with similar characteristics are currently already included in the Olympic programme such as Archery and Shooting. Darts is a true test of precision, accuracy, strategy, hand-eye coordination and pressure.

We, the undersigned urge the Government to step in, in order for Darts to have the best chance at becoming an Olympic Sport, and to gain the recognition the sport and it's competitors deserve.

attributes.action: Stop funding Free Childcare for parents who do not work
attributes.background: The Government currently fund free childcare places for children over 2 years old, if the parents fall within a set 'eligibility criteria'. This includes Job Seekers Allowance. Surely parents who are unemployed can look after their own children. Maybe Job Centre can issue vouchers for interviews etc

attributes.action: Make London into a free WiFi city.
attributes.background: The government should implement free WiFi in London. This would give access to people who ordinarily would not be able to afford it. It would also encourage businesses and citizens to move to London. It has been tested in many cities around the world with great success.

attributes.action: Lower the tax rate for health care workers
attributes.background: I request that the government consider lowering the tax rate of 20% over the threshold to 15% for health care workers on lower wages such as care assistance, Nurses. Currently health care workers are many paid at the living wage.

attributes.action: make it illegal to buy or sell animals within 1 month before Christmas
attributes.background: Many animals are sent to shelters as unwanted xmas presents right after xmas
attributes.additional_details: Leeds Dogs trust has received 500 calls re rehoming since xmas and this is just one city and this is repeated all over the country

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing assessments for PIP and make fit for Mental Health sufferers.
attributes.background: The current assessment trivialises common issues like depression and anxiety and does not take these into consideration when deciding these claims. The form and the assessor only consider physical ailments and not how mental ability often prevent physical ability and is tantamount to discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: ATOS Healthcare also often misrepresent an individuals needs and conversations they have had during PIP assessments and this has been well documented in the press and many websites previously. Here are a couple of examples: http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/new-claims-of-atos-assessment-lies-are-tip-of-a-massive-iceberg/ and http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/atos-nurse-lied-about-pip-claimant-attending-assessment-alone/

attributes.action: Ban deer hunting
attributes.background: Hunting is cruel and unnecessary it causes pain and suffering many deer endure prolonged and painful death when they are injured but not killed by hunters This violent form of "entertainment" leaves countless orphaned or badly injured when hunters miss their target quick kills are rare
attributes.additional_details: A British study of deer hunting found that 11 percent of deer killed by hunters die only after being shot two or more times and that some wounded deer suffer for more than 15 minutes before dying

attributes.action: Set a minimum standard for baby change and feed facilities in food outlets
attributes.background: Having seen my wife breastfeed our 3-month old daughter in numerous baby/parent facilities of varying hygiene and quality, I believe there should be a government-set minimum standard for dedicated rooms including all the following - baby change table, toilet, sink, paper towels and a feeding chair.
attributes.additional_details:
John Lewis and Fenwick's are companies setting high standards.  I have visited worse including M&S stores who combine baby facilities with a disabled toilet (no chair/poor hygiene) and Tesco (no toilet), whilst several Costa branches don't have anywhere private to sit so feeding has to be done standing up in the toilet.
As a father I see my wife feeding our baby in conditions that are poor and unhygienic for both parent/child, whilst I experience the lack of toilet facilities in changing areas.

attributes.action: Halt the rise in Southern train fares until the end of the strikes
attributes.background: The strike by ASLEF and RMT has severely affected the quality of the service on Southern Rail and it could be argued that the price of the rail fare should not be increased until such a time when negotiations between Southern Rail and the Unions reach a close.

attributes.action: Ban cyclist strobe lights and flashing lights.
attributes.background: We all know the lights, the ones that blind you and flash at you and distract you whilst driving. A dimmer, non-flashing light would be much safer, the amount of people I have seen driving get distracted by those lights are ridiculous!

attributes.action: Introduce stricter laws & screening on people receiving benefits/social housing
attributes.background: Taxpayers contribute to the upkeep of social housing and benefits system. Many people on benefits abuse the system and many people living in council properties actually let the property out or do not look after / damage the property which then will have to be repaired and paid for by taxpayers.
attributes.additional_details: Experience in construction industry.

attributes.action: charge UKentrants £10 a week insurance to cover possible use of our NHS
attributes.background: At the moment a lot of money is lost from free treatment and chasing for payment for treatment with a set duty of £10 a week Im sure the NHS would be a lot better off

attributes.action: Bring back the car MOT and tax reminders and make them free!
attributes.background: A while ago the DVLA started using a text messaging system to inform people that their vehicle tax and MOT was due. To my knowledge this feature was soon made a paid subscription. With tax discs now gone innocent good people are forgetting their tax and MOT. In this day and age this should be free!

attributes.action: Ban the Broadcasting of Animal Abuse for Entertainment on Television
attributes.background: This petition calls for the government to place a ban on the broadcasting on television of animal abuse for the purposes of entertainment. It would not include other reasons - such as for charitable and educational purposes.

attributes.action: Withdraw all UK Government funding from PSNI.
attributes.background: Since the 'Good Friday' agreement there has been a total lack of commitment to investigate even-handedly the incidents which occurred during the conflict.  Some terrorists have actually received 'get out of jail' cards - yet the HIT are now concentrating on ex-members of HM Forces.

attributes.action: we need to follow the example of other countries and burn landfill for energy
attributes.background: Landfill is taking over a lot of land in the UK. We should follow by example and burn our rubbish for recycled energy

attributes.action: Free to Use Gym Facilities for Under 18s in Full Time Education.
attributes.background: Currently, Childhood Obesity stands at about 20% and could increase just like the last 20 years. I think it should be required to have Gym Facilities in Schools and/or a free membership to Local Gyms for Under 18s in Full Time Education to reduce Obesity in Children and Teenagers.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-03-21/facts-about-the-uks-growing-obesity-crisis/

http://www.noo.org.uk/NOO_about_obesity/child_obesity

attributes.action: The government to legislate that all Local Authorities Provide Public Toilets.
attributes.background: To many Local Authorities are closing Public Toilets,to try and save money caused by the governments cut backs. The people of the UK deserve to have the essential use of public toilets. Local Authorities need to be accountable for this Public Service.

attributes.action: Increase defence spending to at least 3.5% of GDP.
attributes.background: The number of combat ships in service is woefully low. This isn't acceptable for an island nation. We should have a steady return to 1985 levels , otherwise risk getting caught short , like nearly happened with the Falklands conflict.

attributes.action: Allow HMRC to provide tax exemptions where clerical errors have occurred
attributes.background: I dissolved a company rather than wound it up, and therefore HMRC is applying income tax rather than capital gains tax on the distributions. This was a clerical error, but there is no way to wind back the clock on such errors. HMRC should have the power to apply exemptions under such circumstances.

attributes.action: To have a legal maximum temperature in the work place.  A maximum of 25 degrees.
attributes.background: Working for long periods of time in constant heat above 30 degrees can lead to health problems  including headaches, vomiting, lung problems, dry skin.  Having a maximum temperature will result in happier staff and staff not needing yo take as many sick days.
attributes.additional_details: Hopefully it can be included in the health and safety at work act.

attributes.action: reverse the the decision not to allow cashing in of annuities
attributes.background: many people had made financial arrangements based on the promise that annuities could be cashed in

attributes.action: Limit the resale of event tickets to a maximum of double the face value
attributes.background: Recently I have attempted to purchase tickets for my favourite artists, only to find that they are sold out in seconds.  If this was by genuine fans, then I'd understand. However, its not.  Immediately on checking Stubhub, there are hundreds available that people are buying to make profits from.
attributes.additional_details: Adele tickets, Face Value £123.00 selling for over £1500 on stub hub within 12 minutes of the sale going live.

attributes.action: Forbid the use of CCTV by local councils for parking enforcement purposes
attributes.background: I am writing this as my local council is using a CCTV camera on a regular basis for the purpose of parking enforcement. The guidelines state this method should be used only "where other means of enforcement are not practical" - but nothing is more practical that a cheap and covert CCTV camera.
attributes.additional_details:
Taken from section 1.13 of Surveillance Camera Code of Practice, June 2013, Home office:

"Motorists may regard enforcement by cameras as over-zealous and relevant authorities should use them sparingly. Such systems should , therefore, only be deployed where other means of enforcement are not practical and their effectiveness in achieving this purpose is subject to regular review."

attributes.action: Introducing a theory test with Motorcycle Compulsory basic training
attributes.background: Motorcycles are an increasing form of transport, from delivery, commuting to pleasure. New motorcycle riders with no experience can legally ride without adequate training. Learner Motorcycle riders do not need to pass a theory test, producing inconsiderate, dangerous riders with poor road safety.
attributes.additional_details:
Current legislation states that a rider, whether young, old and of all level of experiences can learn to ride a motorcycle on the roads by simply completing a Compulsory basic training course. 
This consists of a manoeuvring and bike control session, then a road competence ride which is supervised.
During the CBT an instructor will assess your knowledge of the Highway code. This is not enough, too many riders put themselves at risk by not fully understanding the rules of the road.

attributes.action: Make the carrying and use of self defence weapons legal for woman in the U.K.
attributes.background: In the UK it's illegal to own, carry or use self defence weapons such as CS gas or pepper spray.  Statistics for violent and sexual crimes are on the rise with more woman being attacked each day. A system needs to be put in place where woman can legally own, carry and use self defence weapons.
attributes.additional_details:
http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
http://www.bsdgb.co.uk/index.php?Information:Law_Relating_to_Self_Defence

attributes.action: Stop Private Railway Operators from wheel clamping under Railway Byelaw14
attributes.background: Vehicle clamping by private companies was deemed illegal in England and Wales in October 2012. However, Private Railway Operators can still legally exploit an old Railway Byelaw(14) which allows them to continue an aggressive campaign against railway passengers parking in their car parks.
attributes.additional_details:
They enlist private Contractors to handle this duty, and as a result, are generating thousands of pounds in revenue from excessive use of wheel clamping and by applying disproportionate penalties and release costs, for aggressive commercial gain.

Its time this ended, so please sign this petition if you believe the Department of Transport should take action, to ensure Railway Operators and their private clamping Contractors have to abide by the same Laws as anywhere else in the Country.

attributes.action: Change the law so neighbours can't play loud music at anytime not just after 11
attributes.background: In todays world people don't just work 9 till 5 and require sleep at various hrs of the day. Police have no powers to intervene before 11pm or after 7am. People have been forced to move and made ill from being forced to put up with music played unacceptably loud within flats.

attributes.action: Include Religious Studies as a Humanities subject in the English Baccalaureate.
attributes.background: The exclusion of RS from the EBacc is leading to a reduction in the overall understanding of religion in the UK, and suggests that RS is an unimportant subject. In a world increasingly defined by a lack of understanding of religious belief, this is a clear mistake by the Government.

attributes.action: parliament make a law. No levy on diesel cars before park & ride system in place
attributes.background:
As an asthmatic i find towns with no Park & Ride, such as Southampton, cause irritation to the lung,s.
It is irresponsible  not to provide the facilities for shopper & visitor traffic to park outside the city.
We cannot clean up air quality, if we just encourage more & more vehicle,s into Towns

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to fill out military medical forms within 48 hours.
attributes.background: Military applicants rely on their doctor to fill out a medical form involving medical history of the applicant. However doctors tend to sit on this paperwork for weeks, delaying the applicants entry process (which is very frustrating).
attributes.additional_details: Doctors get payed by the army, navy, airforce to fill these forms out and still sit on them for weeks even though many forms come with an urgent warning.

attributes.action: Get Britain to join the North Atlantic Free Trade Area
attributes.background: Britain has left the undemocratic and overbearing EU but we still need to trade with the rest of the world.  So lets join NAFTA and not have to worry about a NAFTA parliament or "ever closer integration".

attributes.action: Clamp down on the tax loop holes for contractors and limited companies.
attributes.background: Certain contractors are avoiding tax by paying corporation tax at 20pc and taking a modest wage plus dividends from the company, they save on income tax and National Insurance contributions. Some are also able to keep child benefits because their “wage” is under the threshold.
attributes.additional_details: Throughout the course of my career I have seen a major shift in work employment, from employees moving from being permanent PAYE to self employed or contracting predominantly for tax benefits. If we continue down this path of legal tax avoidance, soon there will be nobody permanently employed, declaring a full salary and paying their tax in relation to their actual earnings.  Some individuals are actually qualifying themselves for child support by declaring low salaries. This is morally wrong.

attributes.action: Prevent companies from automatically opting us in to third party marketing.
attributes.background: When calling various service providers such as car insurance companies, housing insurance, mobile phone companies there is often a prerecorded massage at the start of the call stating that they will pass on your details to third party companies for marketing purposes, you need to ask to be opted out
attributes.additional_details:
Having spent 20 minutes online trying to get car insurance quotes and speaking to 1 company who had a similar pre recorded message that was unable to provide the required service I have been plagued by sales calls trying to sell me similar and unrelated products due to being automatically opted in.

This practice is wrong and parasitic, if companies want to sell or benefit from marketing your details they should be the ones asking, the burden to opt out should not be placed on the consumer.

attributes.action: Toughen Rules on online gambling & self exclusion in the UK
attributes.background: After going through a massive gambling problem myself I believe the UK is still failing to protect problem gamblers. I believe if you are self excluded from one company this should exclude you from all companies as there's way too many and you can just open another account.
attributes.additional_details: Also many companies although not all do not make it easy for you to be able to check if a particular site is owned by one you are already excluded from. and more than often if this happens the company is just taking your money and hiding behind daft T&CS. and not really helping the problem gambler. Also make it standard practice to have self exclusion buttons on uk gaming sites again to protect the player and so they can be instantly excluded.

attributes.action: Stop the addictive drug Codeine being sold as an over the counter medicine.
attributes.background:
Many people are finding themselves taking Codeine on a regular basis through over the counter pain killers and cough medicine even when symptoms have stopped.
Codeine is an Opiate drug.
Despite fairly recent warnings on the packets and from sales assistants, people are becoming addicted.
attributes.additional_details:
Information on Codeine addiction and where to get help can be found online.
Many people are using these drugs to relax, get to sleep etc and becoming dependant.
This is a serious problem and health issue with a suprising amount of people finding themselves addicted and sales of these drugs are increasing.
Making these drugs prescription only and providing help for people who have become addicted would be a simple solution to the problem, manufacturers are the only ones benefitting from it.

attributes.action: Keep the BARRED list, scrap the DBS - help people with convictions get jobs.
attributes.background: Prison, fine or anything other than the lifetime of the DBS which prevents many  British people (not so much foreign nationals) from working, as teachers or within the NHS. It is obvious that the British poor tend to be affected.
attributes.additional_details: It will in the long run cause a deficit in British society as more British people are thrown on to the (never get a job heap).

attributes.action: DBS/CRB should be all cleared with in 5years depending on seriousness e.g theft
attributes.background: It's unfair to those who have changed for the good and find it difficult to get employment. If they havn't committed any other offences during crime that took place should be cleared and give a second chance in life.Also depending on the seriousness of the crime. For petty offences should be cleared

attributes.action: Government must do more to help councils build more council homes
attributes.background: The lack of affordable housing is a chronic problem, and has got worse as years have gone on. I became disabled due to a fall at work, and am now in wheelchair. I suffer with chronic pain. I'm stuck in a first floor flat have been trying for years to get a bungalow or ground floor flat with no luck.

attributes.action: Increase digital government funding and introduce online voting
attributes.background:
- Increase funding of GovUK development
- Introduce citizens' and residents' online certificates for online voting and online conclusion of contracts
attributes.additional_details:
Gov.uk website is a robust but limited online application which is created to simplify life for interacting with government. This petition is aiming to state the importance to increase funding of more rapid development of digital services of the government.
Other ideas to discuss:
- Introduce digital citizenship (see Estonia)
- Introduce emails for all citizens where all communication lands
This may help to make UK more competitive.

attributes.action: Add an extra voting option to the next election of "Electoral Reform!"
attributes.background: Every year I vote for an less popular party as a type of "rebel" vote. This is the only way I feel heard. Now is the time to allow the public to express their concerns about the way OUR government is elected! Brexit has given us a new opportunity to concentrate on The UK! Let us be heard!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/
